entry.title: 546: A Very Tidy Excuse
entry.summary: The messy details and tidy excuses we noticed in all this OpenAI upset, and some fundamental problems that have been plaguing desktop Linux for years.

entry.title: 538: Surprisingly Smooth Transition
entry.summary: PipeWire hits 1.0, and Wim Taymans joins us to reflect on the smooth success of PipeWire. Plus the details on the first NixCon North America, and more. Special Guests: Wim Taymans and Zach Mitchell.

entry.title: 545: Sam's Busy Weekend
entry.summary: OpenAI's weekend coup, plus our thoughts on Microsoft's gambit and their looming risk.

entry.title: 537: This Makes Us Unemployable
entry.summary: Can we save an old Arch install? We'll attempt a live rescue, then get into our tips for keeping your old Linux install running great.

entry.title: 544: Microsoft Already Did It
entry.summary: Yet another thing Microsoft was early to, and still somehow missed the boat. Plus, building a PC is rare; it's a solved problem. If AI tools excel as expected, will coding face a similar fate?

entry.title: 536: Plasma Power-Ups
entry.summary: The problem with GNOME's great news, plus our first look at Plasma 6. Then, the surprising place NixOS is getting adopted.

entry.title: 535: Hit the Turbo
entry.summary: A special guest joins us, and we each give Fedora 39 a try. What’s new, what we liked, and what didn’t make the cut! Special Guest: Drew DeVore.

entry.title: 543: For Your Safety
entry.summary: New AI "regulation" from on high this week, a few signs you might be pissing in your own pond, and the game dev team that's been together for 40 years.
